definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)

sentences.english: He was dead, killed in a hail of bullets.
sentences.chinese: 他在一陣彈雨中中彈身亡。

sentences.english: First and foremost, the Bride survives a bullet in the head.
sentences.chinese: 最最重要的，新娘頭部中彈還能活下來。

sentences.english: I find it to be the most comfortable-playing guitar I've ever owned.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲他是我的收藏中彈起來最舒服的一把吉他。

sentences.english: Captain Louie Perea says one twin died while the other survived with a single gunshot wound to her head, The Denver Post reports.
sentences.chinese: 警員說一人死亡，另一人頭部中彈但是保住了性命。

sentences.english: At the end of the postfix expression, pop a result from the stack.
sentences.chinese: 到後綴表達式末尾，從堆棧中彈出結果。

sentences.english: He was shot dead in a gunfight.
sentences.chinese: 他在一次槍戰中中彈身亡。

sentences.english: The object reference is popped from the stack and unboxed to a value type pointer.
sentences.chinese: 從堆棧中彈出對象引用並取消裝箱爲值類型指針。

sentences.english: USB equipment pops up in the computor.
They faked the fall and then picked themselves up and ran hard.
sentences.chinese: 他們假裝中彈倒下，然後爬起來拚命跑。

sentences.english: Hit on the head, the enemy officer dropped dead instantly.
sentences.chinese: 那個敵軍官因頭部中彈當即倒斃。

sentences.english: Each Panther caught fire, and all the crews who escaped were badly burned.
sentences.chinese: 每輛豹子都中彈起火，逃出來的裝甲兵全被嚴重燒傷。

sentences.english: A 22-year-old Hispanic man died of gunshot wounds, police said.
sentences.chinese: 警察說，一名22歲西班牙男子中彈身亡。

definition: to shoot with a gun/shooting incident
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
to meet violent death/to get killed
lit. to punch and kick (idiom); to beat up/fig. determined to sort out a problem
to shoot dead (with a gun, or bow and arrow)
to abrade/to scrape/to chafe/to graze/abrasion/friction burn/scratch
to wound with a blade or hatchet/to slash/to gash
